title: 1 killed, 1 hurt in separate shootings Thursday
content:
One person was killed and another wounded Thursday in separate shootings on Milwaukee's west and northwest sides, according to Milwaukee police.
A victim described only as a male was found dead about 10:30 a.m. in the 200 of N. 38th St., according to a news release from the Milwaukee Police Department.
And a 27-year-old man is expected to survive after being shot about 12:30 a.m. during a dispute in the in the 7900 block of W. Appleton Ave., according to police.
Also Thursday, Milwaukee police identified a man found shot to death about 12:30 p.m. Wednesday in the 4200 block of N. 21st St. as Vincent L. Williams, 44.
Police were seeking suspects in all three shootings.
